thread.title: 'Boris is Boris' says Michael Gove as Johnson warns of Brexit 'meltdown'

author: Joel Cooper
title: 'Boris is Boris' says Michael Gove as Johnson warns of Brexit 'meltdown'
text:
'Boris is Boris' says Michael Gove as Johnson warns of Brexit 'meltdown' "He's a one-off - I'm a big Boris fan and I would never criticise him." Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Michael Gove has backed foreign secretary and Brexit companion Boris Johnson after he was recorded saying that Brexit talks were in "meltdown" and that Donald Trump could handle the negotiations better.
Speaking on a visit to North Devon this morning, Mr Gove, who is secretary of state for Defra, said "Boris is Boris" and that Mr Johnson had a "unique style of expressing himself and getting his message across".
Yesterday it was revealed that during a speech made at a private dinner, Boris Johnson criticised the government's Brexit negotiations. Read More Huge cash injection for parks and play areas across North Devon
He told those in attendance that the Treasury was "at the heart of Remain" and that the UK could remain "locked in orbit around the EU".
Speaking at Crosse Farm in Bishops Nympton this morning Mr Gove, who successfully campaigned for Brexit with Mr Johnson, said: "Boris is Boris - he's a one-off. Read More We cornered Michael Gove on the failing Devon free school where all the governors quit
"None of us can sum up a political situation or bring language to life in the way that Boris does.
"He has a unique style when expressing himself and getting a message across and that's wrapped up with his personality and his charisma." Michael Gove pictured with North Devon MP Peter Heaton-Jones and DevonLive chief reporter Joel Cooper at Crosse Farm in Bishops Nympton (Image: Paula Davies)
Mr Gove said he was a "big Boris fan" and that he would "never criticise him".
He added: "I think the rest of us have to realise that he expresses himself with a panache that the rest of us can't match." Read More
